title: DRAKON PITANIOS
content:
THE DRAKON PITANIOS (Pitanean Dragon) was a giant serpent turned to stone by the gods in the region of Pitane
        in Aiolia, Anatolia. There was no doubt some local legend about the creature which described this metamorphosis.

Ovid, Metamorphoses 7. 357 (trans. Melville) (Roman epic C1st B.C. to C1st A.D.)
          :
        "Pitane of Aeolis [in Asia Minor], down on the left, where the long Draco (Dragon) lay, a shape of
        stone."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
